page.title: 03BOXWORTH - ENTERTAINMENT
page.content: Boxworth can be said to be a quiet village, the two focal points of entertainment being the Golden Ball public house and the Church Hall. Whereas the public house is used by most residents throughout the month, the Church Hall is used infrequently. The Women's Institute use it once a month and there is the occasional private party. Most people in the village say there is very little to do and if they require sophisticated entertainment such as cinema or theatre, they visit Cambridge or Huntingdon. Private cars are essential as public transport does not pass through the village late at night. The village is well endowed with public paths and woodlands which are often used. On the A604 there is another public house often used, "The Trinity Foot".
